thread.title: Mueller’s Tax Case Against Manafort Rests on Hard-to-Get Evidence

author: Aruna Viswanatha
title: Mueller’s Tax Case Against Manafort Rests on Hard-to-Get Evidence
text:
WASHINGTON—Paul Manafort, President Donald Trump’s former campaign chairman, faces an uphill battle in fighting the tax charges levied against him, former tax prosecutors say, given the extent of the evidence prosecutors have detailed against him and other recent developments in the case.
Special counsel Robert Mueller’s prosecutors have cleared what are often the biggest hurdles in offshore tax cases, experts said, including obtaining financial records from difficult jurisdictions including Cyprus and St. Vincent & the... RELATED VIDEO What People Really Mean When They Say 'Collusion' When it comes to the Russia investigation, the word ‘collusion’ gets thrown around a lot. But what does it mean? We asked a law professor to explain. Photo Illustration: Drew Evans/The Wall Street Journal.
